intro: Lysakia, commonly known as the "scented dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are characterized by their yellow flowers and pinnate leaves. Lysakia species typically grow in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. The flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological diversity. Some species are cultivated for their ornamental value or as part of traditional herbal medicine.
